channel.title: How-to-uses on Linux VM Images - Download VirtualBox and VMware Images
channel.description: Recent content in How-to-uses on Linux VM Images - Download VirtualBox and VMware Images

item.title: How To Import VM Images in VirtualBox (OVA File)
item.description: Step 1: Go to the downloads directory of your system (default one) or to the location where you have saved the VM image. Step 2: Extract the VM zip file using WinZip or 7-Zip program. Extract Downloaded VM Archive File Step 3: Open the VirtualBox. Open VirtualBox Step 4: Go to file » Import Appliance. Import Virtual Appliance Step 5: On the Import Virtual Appliance wizard, click the browse icon button to choose a VM file to import.

item.title: How To Import VM Images in VMware Workstation (OVF File)
item.description: Step 1: Go to the downloads directory of your system (default one) or to the location where you have saved the VM image. Step 2: Extract the VM zip file using WinZip or 7-Zip program. Extract Downloaded VM Archive File Step 3: Open VMware Workstation and go to File » Open. Import Virtual Appliance Step 4: Browse to the location where you have extracted the VM image. Select the image and then click on Open.

item.title: How To Import VM Images in VirtualBox (VDI File)
item.description: Step 1: Go to the downloads directory of your system (default one) or to the location where you have saved the VM image. Step 2: Extract the compressed file using the 7-Zip. Extract Downloaded VM Archive File Optionally, move the extracted folder to where you have your other VMs data/disk files Step 3: Go to the extracted folder and then double-click the .vbox file. Open Vbox File Step 4: In a second or two, VirtualBox will open and you should see the new virtual machine.

item.title: How To Import VM Images in VMware Workstation (VMDK File)
item.description: Step 1: Go to the downloads directory of your system (default one) or to the location where you have saved the VM image. Step 2: Extract the compressed file using the 7-Zip. Extract Downloaded VM Archive File Optionally, move the extracted folder to where you have your other VMs. Step 3: Open VMware Workstation and go to File » Open. Import Virtual Appliance Step 4: Browse to the location where you have extracted the VM image.

item.title: VM Image Password?
item.description: Are you wondering about login credentials for the downloaded image? No worries. Here you can find a list of passwords. Search your image and get the password. The username and password will be the same for all versions of a specific operating system. ROOT Password is linuxvmimages.com IMAGE USERNAME / PASSWORD CentOS centos / centos Ubuntu ubuntu / ubuntu Debian debian / debian Fedora fedora / fedora Linux Mint linuxmint / linuxmint MX Linux mxlinux / mxlinux Manjaro manjaro / manjaro Elementary OS elementaryos / elementaryos Solus OS solus / solus Deepin deepin / deepin KDE neon kdeneon / kdeneon Antix antix / antix Kubuntu kubuntu / kubuntu Pop!
